Description:
Dual Living on the Golf Course
This exciting property measures over one acre in size, boasts two dwellings and stunning gardens. Sitting on the fringe of the 14th Tee & the 13th Green of the Forest Resort the serenity rolls on. In arguably Creswick's quietest street, the main abode offers four generous bedrooms, an ensuite to the master and two bright living rooms overlooking lush gardens. The large woodfire will ensure you keep warm all year round. The second home has two bedrooms and is self-contained, making the perfect spot for the extended family, guest house or even rent it out separately to generate an alternate income. Adjoining the main dwelling is a large entertaining area that makes for the perfect spot to sit back and relax as you look over your beautiful landscape garden and take in golf course views. There is also the added benefit of great shedding outside, perfect for home workshop or storage. Properties such as these are rare to find and the tranquil setting only adds to that, be quick to book your inspection before it's too late.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Description:
Picturesque 2 Acres Rate Recovery Auction
Set in picturesque locale is this .85 HA (8500 m2) allotment. Located in a Farming Zone the property is well suited to weekend getaway and house site (STCA).
The property has a dam, is lightly treed and existing fencing. Power is available (no water)
This property is well situated close to wineries, short drive to Talbot and Clunes and their popular farmers markets and Cafes. This property is being offered for sale by the Pyrenees shire as a part of their S181 Rate Recovery Auction and will be Auctioned on site.

Description:
Country Lifestyle Allotment with Planning Permit
A cleared and level allotment of approx. 2428 sq.m (half acre +) enjoying a prime location in Newlyn, just a 10 minute drive to Daylesford or Creswick, 20 minutes to Ballarat and around 90 minutes to Melbourne. With current planning permit, rich soil and plenty of space for gardens and shedding, this property offers the perfect site for your new country lifestyle home.
Township Zone - Hepburn Shire
Town water, electricity available
5 minute walk to Newlyn Primary School, school bus to Ballarat nearby
Adjoining allotment, also 2400 sq.m approx. also available (CA15 2871 Midland Hwy)

Description:
First Home Buyers, Downsizers and Investors Take Note
Superbly positioned just moments from the Doug Lindsay Recreation Reserve, Creswick Primary School, and of course all the delights of Creswick, this appealing cream brick, triple fronted family home with big front veranda is an exemplary choice for first home buyers, young families, downsizers or investors with an expected rental of $320-$330 a week.
The light and bright interior begins with a spacious lounge with large panoramic windows, split system, gas heating, ceiling fan and flowing connection to the dining area and open plan kitchen.
The kitchen is well equipped and highly functional with ample storage, good preparation space and a hideaway appliance/pantry cupboard to keep things neat and tidy.
All three bedrooms are spacious and light filled and you are offered a semi updated family bathroom, an independent laundry/mudroom with separate second toilet which adds further convenience and appeal to the overall floorplan.
A freestanding garage with long driveway to the side creates loads of room to park off the street, while the 559m2 allotment is neatly tailored with established shrubs, grass expanses and a low brick fence indicative of these mid-century marvels. The rear yard offers a concreted area for dirt free play
With school bus pick up to the front, the Creswick Railway Station just moments away and with room to play within the yard or at the nearby reserve, this superbly positioned home with NBN connection along with all other services offers endless lifestyle advantages.
Call our agent today for further details.

Description:
GOLD FIELDS COUNTRY
7.5 Acres (approx.) in historic and magnificent area of Victoria. Close to Talbot, Lexton, Waubra, this Evansford property provides a place to hide and enjoy the real meaning of life.
Great American barn (2 roller doors and steel frame).
Concrete floor, bonus woodheater, water tank plus sundry shedding. This scenic block with beautiful gums and creek bed.
Close to popular Pyrenees townships of Avoca and other historic destinations and wine.
ZONED FARMING NO POWER NEARBY
Directions from Ballarat- Take the Sunraysia Hwy through Learmonth and turn right to Evansford on the Eastern fringe of Waubra. ( church on corner and follow to Evansford)
Proceed through the township and turn right into West Eads Road which is past Simpsons Lane.
AGENT ON SITE AT NOMINATED TIMES

Description:
Immaculate Country Home in Newlyn
Positioned in an ideal location and surrounded by stunning rural views is this near new executive family home on almost 1.2 acres (4856 m2 approx). With an exceptional outdoor entertaining area, tasteful landscaping and ample shedding and located at the end of a quiet road just 10 minutes from both Daylesford & Creswick. This is a rare opportunity to secure such a substantial home in the tightly held township of Newlyn.
With 3 bedrooms all with BIRs and wall to wall carpets, large master bedroom with Walk through robes and full en-suite and a flexible floor plan allowing the potential of a 4th bedroom if so desired, this home ticks all the boxes.
The kitchen has stainless steel appliances with 900mm oven with 5 burner cook top and a central island bench complete with double sink and floating timber floors that flow through to the open plan dining room. This connects to the carpeted family area complete with wood fired combustion heater and evaporative cooling and double sliding door access to the expansive timber decked entertaining area.
The main bathroom offers independent shower and bath with a full vanity and the extra benefit of a separate toilet.
The custom built stables and tack room are positioned next to 5 small fully fenced holding paddocks, ideal for the family with a pony or two in mind.
With the main shed alone measuring 9 x 12 metres, whatever your job, hobby or pursuit you will not fall short.
Add to this ample water storage from 2 tanks, 5kw Solar panels feeding back into the grid, post and rail fencing to the street and the added security of the existing 7 year builders guarantee. Be sure to inspect quickly as this property will not last long.

Description:
Ultimate Country Living in Sunny Smeaton
This exceptional, custom design home built by GJ Gardiner Ballarat has been finished to an impeccably high standard and is sure to please. A main feature of this delightful home is the amazing open trusses through the kitchen, dining & family area. At almost 5 metres high, the natural light flows in.
Boasting a master suite of executive size, the remaining bedrooms and study are generous with built-in robes and ample storage. A theatre room for relaxation, an established garden outdoors with turf lawns, animal secure fencing and your own orchard; just unwind, take in and enjoy spectacular views of the rolling hills and peaceful rural surrounds.
Additional features of this beautiful home include a triple car garage with extra workshop space and storage, ducted recycle air-conditioning, double glazed windows, energy efficient lighting, evacuated tube solar hot water, separate powder area and more.
This is a great opportunity to live and enjoy the country life. Only 6 minutes to Creswick and a short drive to Daylesford or Ballarat. Inspection by appointment only. Call today to find out more.

Description:
Picturesque lifestyle on approx. half an acre.
Located in the charming and ever-growing township of Creswick, this sturdy brick home presents a rare opportunity to buy into the locale.
Upon entry, you are greeted with generous sized proportions, with no doubt that this home is built for the family and entertaining lifestyle.
The well sized master bedroom includes walk in robe and ensuite, with the further three bedrooms featuring built in robes and serviced by the main bathroom with separate toilet. The open plan kitchen and dining lead through to the living and study for convenience.
Step downstairs and you will find a pool room, perfect for year-round entertaining with direct access to the back yard and built-in natural gas BBQ. Those who are energy conscious will be delighted with the hydronic heating throughout and complimented with 4kw solar power.
Situated on a generous size allotment of just under half an acre of beautiful natural landscaping, with plenty of room for the kids to run around and to make your own. The property also features a 4500L watertank and rear access to the large double garage.
Creswick is a growing town increasingly becoming known for its friendly atmosphere, café culture and its emphasis on local community support. Being only a short drive to both Daylesford and Ballarat and an easy commute to Melbourne this property is convenient to everything.
You won't be disappointed upon viewing, so make sure to call today to book your inspection.

Address: 797 Coghills Creek Road Coghills Creek VIC 3364
Description:
4 Bedroom Eco House on 1 Acre
The Phone Code for this property is: 15612. Please quote this number when phoning or texting.
When this house was built nine years ago, we needed every room but not anymore so it's time to downsize and sell it to another family who we know will love it as much as we do. We're flexible about settlement and could do next month or in three months. Inspections are welcome & by appointment.
This property is located in a rural environment on the banks of Coghills Creek but is only 20 mins to Ballarat CBD. It has stunning views. The Coghills Creek community is great to be a part of and is very welcoming. A bus to Mt Blowhard PS passes the door as does a bus to the various Ballarat secondary schools including Ballarat High School.
Consisting of three generous queen size bedrooms two with WIR, one king single bedroom, family bathroom with free standing bath, second en-suite bathroom, open kitchen living dining space with granite island bench, quality stainless steel appliances, built in fridge & freezer that come with the house, separate butler's pantry, separate laundry, separate study, double garage connected to the house, chook shed and yard, dog run, 120 thousand litres of water storage, established orchard on dripper system, gorgeous irrigated walled garden, vegetable patch, solar system on premium feed in tariff, solar air heaters, quality split air-conditioner, heat pump hot water with water recirculator, double glazed windows, north facing living space, high levels of insulation, external blinds over north windows and french doors leading onto north and south decks. A great house to live in!

Description:
Tastefully Renovated Home With So Much More.
Situated in the highly sought after community of Creswick is this stylishly renovated and landscaped 3 bedroom home with the entertainers touch. The fresh and on trend external colour scheme and easy to maintain gardens give this home real street appeal and you will continue to be impressed once you enter the home.
The spacious and open plan Lounge-Living zone with combustion wood heating and split system has been freshly tiled along with the modern Kitchen complete with 'Blanco' Cook top and oven, dishwasher and plenty of cupboard space. From here you step down to the family/meals room complete with candelabra folding glass doors that lead to the extensive outdoor decked entertaining area, ideal for get togethers or just sitting back and enjoying your private rear gardens.
The master and second bedroom both have built in robes, wall to wall carpets and the third bedroom is ideal as a nursery, guest room or home office.
The Bathroom is freshly renovated offering a full bath and separate toilet.
A 6 x 7 metre carport offers cover for 4 cars and leads to the expansive 6 x7 metre garage/shed with front roller doors and a rear roller door giving you through access to the rear gardens and rear single garage/shed.
The timber wrap around deck is a true inspiration, giving so much more active living space in the summer months.
Add to this 5kw Solar power, feeding back into the grid, loads of secure off street parking, New colour bond fencing on all sides, fantastic kids cubby house and play area and a rental appraisal of between $330 and $340 a week.
Sitting on a substantial block of 842m2 (approx) and close to transport, sporting facilities, schools and shops, you do not want to miss this Creswick Gem!

Description:
OLD NEWLYN MECHANICS INSTITUTE AND HALL c1866
Steeped in history and offered for the first time in 25 years is this charming old Mechanics Institute, hall & library. Located in the picturesque Newlyn Township 18 kms from Daylesford and only 26 kms from the Ballarat CBD. Here is a unique opportunity to own a historically significant property with intact period features in a highly sought-after position.
The former Mechanic Institute and library were officially opened in 1886 and features a decorative, timber mansard ceiling and a large memorial window. In 1924 there was a further addition of a large room for concerts and dancing followed in 1930 with a porch and smoking room.
The property has for many, many years been successfully run as the Newlyn Antique and Cottage Garden Nursery but is equally suited for a diverse range of uses including a gallery, exhibition space, function centre, restaurant, café or conversion into a funky permanent residence or weekender.
Large 2461m2 site [ 0.6 Acre] approx
Wide timber floor boards
Stage area and adjacent change rooms
Decorative timber mansard ceiling
Period details with gothic style windows
255 m2 [approx.] building area plus shed, glasshouse and outbuilding
Town water, electricity, and 30 panel solar installation

Description:
Rare historical property, former flour mill
Phone Code for this property is: 7739#
UNDER CONTRACT as at 15/10/2019
Romantic triple brick converted mill reminiscent of a European provincial building. In the historical village of Talbot and within walking distance of the train station, Court House Hotel, award winning Talbot Provedore, post office, town hall and Talbot primary school. The famous Talbot Farmers' Market and Town Hall markets fill the streets of Talbot on the third Sunday every month and run right past your door. The property is in need of much love and renovation and promises incredible potential. Talbot is just ten minutes from all services in Maryborough and 15 minutes from the popular village of Clunes in the central goldfields. Two hours from Melbourne and 45 minutes from Ballarat or Castlemaine, the gold rush village is central to so many events and assets of the goldfields in Victoria.
3 BEDS; 1 BATH; DINING ROOM; TWO LIVING AREAS; DOUBLE GARAGE PLUS CARPORT; 5 TITLES; RATED AS ONE PROPERTY; SECOND SEPTIC TANK EXISTS WHERE A SECOND PROPERTY AND HOUSE WAS; TWO STOREY
HIGHLIGHTS: ICONIC BUILDING; BEAUTIFUL PROPORTIONS; CHARACTER; HISTORICAL ELEMENTS; AMPLE & LEVEL LAND; WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE OF ALL TOWN SERVICES
originally a flour mill in the 1800s and converted to a home in the 1980s with famous 'stop that galloping' signage from early 20th century
North facing counter-levered balcony with sunset view
paved surrounds and BBQ area
well treed
four car entrances, site of former second property/home and also a paddock
road/lane access on three sides
triple brick two storey structure
gantry, skylights, large beams, strong features
second toilet and septic on property
wood fire
electricity, town water, internet
room for vegie garden, orchard and small grazing paddock or whatever private or commercial dreams you have in mind
walk to post office (which currently offers milk bar services), pub, Provedore with supplies, railway station and nursery, primary school, Talbot pool, community library, tennis club, galleries etc
atmospheric canvas to work from
some windows and exterior timber needs replacing or painting
former chook shed, wood shed, shade house, garden shed and second (out-door) toilet plus garage
3 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, gutted kitchen, toilet and rear extension needs renovation to be of service, dining room, two lounge areas, stairs and second storey, cement slab front and rear

Description:
Double Block & Walking Distance to Heart of Town
This is a rare opportunity to purchase this fantastic family brick home. So close to town, a 5-minute walk and you will be experiencing the very best a town like Creswick has to offer. This home built in 1990 boasts four bedrooms, a main family bathroom with separate shower and a sizeable corner spa. A large family, casual dining and kitchen space provides the focus on the house, the kitchen with original features including the electric oven/cooktop. The second living area is very generous in size, perfect for entertaining guests, a parent retreat or a perfect hang out for the kids. A separate laundry and double car garage leading out to the back veranda. A low maintenance rear yard complete with inground swimming pool for those who like a dip during the warmer months. Set on a double block and approximately 1776m2 with potential for subdivision (STCA), this home is sure to be popular. A must to inspect, don't miss your opportunity, enquire today!

Description:
Secluded, Tranquil Piece of Paradise in Quiet Creswick Locale
This unique home is perfectly positioned, nestled in a tranquil private position. Overlooking the magnificent public reserve with easy access to the beautiful St Georges Lake. Situated on approx. 521m2, the home itself has been beautifully renovated from front to back, inside and out. Featuring gorgeous tiled entry with coat cupboard and soaring ceilings, youll love the trendy yet warm feel this home offers. Incorporating two large bedrooms, newly refurbished bathroom with separate shower, bath and heat lamps, cosy wood combustion fire and reverse cycle split system for all year-round comfort. The kitchen has also been completely renovated with new Blackwood timber cabinetry, electric oven, ceramic cooktop, range hood and ample storage. The laundry is off the back with good storage and separate toilet. A real feature of the home is the open plan kitchen, meals, living area flowing out onto the private courtyard with breathtaking views, the ideal spot to sit, relax, listen to the wonderful birdlife and entertain with friends. A truly remarkable home thats sure to impress, dont wait, call now to book your private viewing today.

Address: 970 Coghills Creek Road Coghills Creek VIC 3364
Description:
Mount Coghill Vineyard Lifestyle & Business Opportunity
This 3.50 acre property occupies an attractive position surrounded by vineyards and lifestyle properties in the beautiful wine region of Coghills Creek; 22kms North West of Ballarat and 10kms to the historical township of Clunes.
The homestead is a four bedroom, two bathroom residence comprising of an open-plan wood fired living area and kitchen with a separate lounge and dining room with built in bar; currently used as a cellar door to further entertain. Outdoors you will find a large glassed in entertainment area and wide bull nose verandas with views stretching across the vine covered land and distant rolling hills.
This delightful farm is currently trading as Mt Coghill vineyard, with the business name & brand available if required. The vineyard of 2 acres is planted on red volcanic soil which produces a fruit driven wine. Established in 1995 with about 1500 pinot noir rootlings planted followed by 450 chardonnay vines. At an altitude of 430 metres above sea level, the cool climate is ideal for producing high quality wine while the remainder embraces a four-car garage, (back used as a cool room), established gardens, orchard, vegetable patch, extra shedding and water tanks.
There is an opportunity here to develop a boutique farming enterprise, facilitate a B&B, or simply acquire the property as a perfect hobby farm and home with magnificent views from every living room window.
Inspections are strictly by appointment with our agent, call today!

Description:
Centrally located 2 bedroom home with study
In a very private and elevated position this period style property is set well back on the block of 1088sqm. A bay window seat in the formal lounge overlooks the established garden below, while the interior sliding doors on both sides are a delightful feature of the Art Deco period along with the polished timber floors. An open fire place is a feature of the formal dining room which opens onto the front deck.
Gas heating, split system, instantaneous gas hws, 900mm gas cooker, seperate shower & bath
Single carport x2, enclosed yard with rear access, semi circular drive, garden sheds & vegetable patch
Close to bus stop however within easy walking distance to all that Creswick has to offer.

Description:
Picturesque Block With Outlook Over Bushland & Hilltops
This exciting parcel of land is not only sizeable but also grants great views. The block measures 2045m2 granting great space for a well-proportioned home and maybe shedding. The half-acre block is on the Ballarat side of Creswick and almost neighbours the Creswick Golf Club. Along with the wondrous views, there are terrific walking tracks, bike tracks, bird & animal life and more at your future front door. A wonderful locale for a full-time home, there is no doubt that those seeking a quiet and charismatic place for a weekend that this would be ideal. The hub of Creswick is just five minutes walk away and Ballarat is within ten (drive). Those looking to enjoy Daylesford will find it 20 minutes away.
